alert.note: Alert for Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 8:42PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Pasquotank, and northeastern Gates Counties, the southwestern City of Chesapeake and the southeastern City of Suffolk through 930 PM EDT... At 842 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gates, or 7 miles north of Gatesville, moving east to northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Suffolk around 845 PM EDT. Corapeake around 905 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Easons Crossroads, Savage, Nurney, Drum Hill, Hazelton, Buckland, Saunders, Reynoldson, and Somerton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
